analysis: The run failed because the environmental dependency stack was not compatible. Initially, epidemic.py crashed with a ModuleNotFoundError for networkx, and even after installing networkx the network_diffusion package provided did not include the required MultiSpreading class needed by the code.
rationale: Evidence shows that the traceback first reported a missing networkx module (ModuleNotFoundError) [T0B25] and then, upon installation, an ImportError occurred when attempting to import MultiSpreading from network_diffusion [T0B52, T0B97, T0B57]. This indicates that not only was a dependency missing but the available version of network_diffusion is not the correct upstream version needed by epidemic.py.
recommended_actions: Update the repository's dependency list to explicitly include 'networkx' with a correct version.
Investigate and specify the proper version or source for the 'network_diffusion' package so that it contains the MultiSpreading (and associated PropagationModel) class required by epidemic.py.
Review the Readme and installation instructions; if necessary, modify them to reference the correct dependency versions.
Apply an environment override using fix-package env overrides (via env_override.json) to ensure writable directories and configuration necessary for dependency installation.
Adjust input_override (problem_statement.txt or input_override.json) to include clear instructions for installing the correct dependency stack before running epidemic.py.
next_steps: Create or update /Users/ronan/Developer/agent-debug/fixes/corebench_hard/capsule-8807709 with overlays/patches/input/env overrides. Do NOT run the HAL debugger or any rerun commands as part of this step. Do a careful self-review and produce a complete fix package in one pass.
inspector_suggested_next_steps: After applying these fixes and creating the updated fix package, the coding agent should re-run the HAL debugger to validate that the environment now supports the proper dependency stack and that epidemic.py executes successfully.
